intro: Urostigma calyptroceras, commonly known as the clustered sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy stems. The plant has a deep taproot that allows it to survive in dry conditions, and its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs. Urostigma calyptroceras typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in disturbed areas or along roadsides.
